metadata.title: CVE-2013-2173 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
wp-includes/class-phpass.php in WordPress 3.5.1, when a password-protectedpost exists, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPUconsumption) via a crafted value of a certain wp-postpass cookie.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2173` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentyseventeen - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.9.5+dfsg1-1').
